Question
========

One wants to test the hypothesis that the average IQ of Utrecht politicians is 110, against the alternative that the average is higher. In a random sample of 25 politicians from Utrecht, the mean IQ is calculated to be 116 with a standard deviation of 15. the mean IQ is 116 with a standard deviation of 15. It is assumed that IQ is normally distributed. The null hypothesis can now be rejected at a significance level of

Answerlist
----------

* 0.025
* 0.05 but not from 0.025
* 0.10 but not from 0.05

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.025: Incorrect
* 0.05 but not from 0.025: Correct
* 0.10 but not from 0.05: Incorrect
